intro: Pycnandra pubiflora, commonly known as the white-flowered pycnandra, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, white, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub with hairy stems and leaves that are opposite in arrangement. Its fruit is a capsule that contains numerous small seeds. Pycnandra pubiflora is often found in moist, shaded habitats within tropical forests.
